meeting_context:
# North Star & Strategic Context

This file combines the overall project mission (North Star) and summaries of key strategic documents for use in AI prompts, particularly for the AI Agent Council context generation.

---

**North Star:**
To build a truly autonomous, sustainable DAO that develops open-source software accelerating the path toward AGI, blending AI researchers, open-source hackers, and crypto degens to create AI agents streaming, shitposting, and trading 24/7 on auto.fun to attract users and bootstrap an autonomous organization.

---

**ElizaOS Mission Summary (`docs/blog/mission.mdx`):**
The elizaOS mission is to build an extensible, modular, open-source AI agent framework for Web2/Web3, seeing agents as steps toward AGI. Core values are Autonomy, Modularity, and Decentralization. Key products include the framework itself, DegenSpartanAI (trading agent), Autonomous Investor/Trust Marketplace (social trading intelligence), and the Agent Marketplace/auto.fun (launchpad).

---

**ElizaOS Reintroduction Summary (`docs/blog/reintroduction.mdx`):**
elizaOS is an open-source "operating system for AI agents" aimed at decentralizing AI development away from corporate control. It's built on three pillars: 1) The Eliza Framework (TypeScript toolkit for persistent, interoperable agents), 2) AI-Enhanced Governance (building autonomous DAOs), and 3) Eliza Labs (R&D for future capabilities like v2, Trust Marketplace, auto.fun, DegenSpartanAI, Eliza Studios). The native Solana token coordinates the ecosystem and captures value. The vision is an intelligent internet built on open protocols and collaboration.

---

**Auto.fun Introduction Summary (`docs/blog/autofun-intro.mdx`):**
Auto.fun is an AI-native, creator-first token launchpad designed for sustainable AI/crypto projects. It aims to balance fair community access with project funding needs through mechanisms like bonding curves and liquidity NFTs. Key features include a no-code agent builder, AI-generated marketing tools, and integration with the elizaOS ecosystem. It serves as a core product driving value back to the native token ($ai16z) through buybacks and liquidity pairing.

---

**Taming Information Summary (`docs/blog/taming_info.mdx`):**
Addresses the challenge of information scattered across platforms (Discord, GitHub, X). Proposes using AI agents as "bridges" to collect, wrangle (summarize/tag), and distribute information in various formats (JSON, MD, RSS, dashboards, 3D shows). Showcases an AI News system and AI Assistants for tech support as examples. Emphasizes treating documentation as a first-class citizen to empower AI assistants and streamline community operations.
monthly_goal: Current focus: Stabilize and attract new users to auto.fun by showcasing 24/7 agent activity (streaming, trading, shitposting), ship production ready elizaOS v2.
daily_focus: Token migration governance actions introduce strategic prioritization of stability through technical improvements while managing community transition expectations.

key_points.summary: The implementation of a snapshot-based whitelist system for the AI16Z to ElizaOS token migration aims to decouple token price and prevent arbitrage, but has created community confusion and technical challenges requiring manual interventions.

deliberation_items.text: How should we balance the technical requirements of the migration with transparency and user experience?
context: shaw: 'It was done to get price unpegged from AI16Z so it could pump.'
DEMIAN | DAPPCRAFT | ai2^4z: 'Why was this snapshot made and who are you trying to restrict from converting?'

answer_1.text: Prioritize technical stability and price protection by maintaining the snapshot approach with minimal changes.
answer_1.implication: Preserves price mechanisms but risks continued user frustration and potential community fragmentation.

answer_2.text: Create a comprehensive communication campaign explaining the technical rationale while expanding manual migration support.
answer_2.implication: Balances technical needs with improved user experience but requires significant operational resources.

answer_3.text: Implement a phased migration with improved technical infrastructure and clearer eligibility criteria.
answer_3.implication: Addresses both technical and user concerns but would delay the full migration completion.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

deliberation_items.text: What level of direct support should we commit to users with complex migration scenarios (LP tokens, exchange holdings)?
context: DorianD: 'User had AI16Z tokens in liquidity pool during snapshot | Resolution: Suggested filing a support ticket as snapshot likely didn't capture LP positions'
susu: 'Concerns about AI16Z tokens held on Bithumb exchange | Resolution: Shaw confirmed they're working with Bithumb and will manually migrate tokens if needed'

answer_1.text: Prioritize exchange integrations and provide minimal manual support only for verifiable edge cases.
answer_1.implication: Minimizes operational overhead but may leave some legitimate users without resolution.

answer_2.text: Establish a dedicated migration support team with standardized verification processes for all claimed cases.
answer_2.implication: Ensures comprehensive support but significantly increases operational costs and potential for fraud.

answer_3.text: Implement tiered support based on token holdings, with priority given to LP providers and larger holders.
answer_3.implication: Balances resource allocation with business impact but could create perceived inequity among community members.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

key_points.summary: Recent development activity shows a focus on core framework stability and extensibility through enhanced security, environment configuration, and advanced prompting capabilities, raising questions about how to sequence these improvements alongside user-facing features.

deliberation_items.text: Which technical improvements should be prioritized to best support our monthly goal of stabilizing auto.fun and shipping elizaOS v2?
context: PR #6111 titled 'feat: add ElizaOS reference to runtime' is merged, adding ElizaOS reference functionality to the runtime environment.
PR #6141 titled 'fix: load environment variables from process.env instead of .env file' is merged, changing the environment variable loading mechanism.

answer_1.text: Focus on user-facing stability and cross-platform integration (X posts, wallet connections) to immediately improve the auto.fun experience.
answer_1.implication: Directly addresses current user pain points but may accumulate technical debt in core systems.

answer_2.text: Prioritize core framework improvements (environment handling, runtime capabilities) to ensure a stable foundation for v2.
answer_2.implication: Builds long-term stability but may delay visible improvements for end users.

answer_3.text: Balance both approaches by implementing a dual-track development system with separate teams for core improvements and user-facing fixes.
answer_3.implication: Addresses both needs but increases coordination complexity and potential for integration issues.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

deliberation_items.text: How should we position the rebuilt X-like platform with AI agent prediction markets in our strategic roadmap?
context: Team is developing a rebuilt X-like platform with AI agents for prediction markets
Demo planned for upcoming Devconnect event

answer_1.text: Position it as a flagship demonstration capability, accelerating development for the Devconnect event to maximize visibility.
answer_1.implication: Creates a compelling showcase but may divert resources from core stability work.

answer_2.text: Develop it as a secondary feature with limited resource allocation, focusing primarily on auto.fun stability.
answer_2.implication: Maintains focus on monthly goals but risks missing an opportunity for differentiation and attention.

answer_3.text: Integrate it directly into auto.fun as a new capability, unifying our product offerings under a single platform.
answer_3.implication: Strengthens our core product but increases technical complexity and potential for destabilization.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

key_points.summary: The community is experiencing transition pains through the token migration while simultaneously showing interest in expanded capabilities like university partnerships and AI TV projects, suggesting a need for more structured engagement models.

deliberation_items.text: How can we leverage the token migration period to strengthen community alignment with our North Star mission?
context: Team is working with exchanges (Bithumb, Binance, Kraken) to facilitate migration for CEX users

answer_1.text: Use the migration as an opportunity to realign community expectations through educational content about our strategic vision.
answer_1.implication: Builds deeper understanding but may not address immediate migration frustrations.

answer_2.text: Implement a tiered incentive system rewarding early migrators with special access to new agent capabilities.
answer_2.implication: Accelerates migration but could create perception of favoritism or inequality.

answer_3.text: Create community-driven governance votes on specific features to be developed during the migration window.
answer_3.implication: Increases engagement but may commit resources to features not aligned with core strategic priorities.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

deliberation_items.text: Should we formalize partnership strategies with academic institutions and media projects to expand our ecosystem?
context: Potential university partnerships with UT Austin robotics department mentioned
Team member Jin is working on a new AI TV show project

answer_1.text: Prioritize formal partnerships with selective institutions that directly advance our technical capabilities.
answer_1.implication: Focuses resources on high-impact collaborations but may limit broader ecosystem growth.

answer_2.text: Establish an open partnership framework allowing community members to represent elizaOS in various contexts.
answer_2.implication: Enables organic growth but risks inconsistent representation of our vision and capabilities.

answer_3.text: Create a hybrid model with core strategic partnerships managed centrally and a community ambassador program for broader outreach.
answer_3.implication: Balances control with scale but requires significant coordination resources.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.
